IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.
 

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Stampede Meat, Inc. operations. Stampede Meat, Inc. is currently implementing their Process Safety Management Program. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Stampede Meat, Inc.  

XI.	Management Program
Stampede Meat, Inc. has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar documen

•	Incident Investigation – Stampede Meat, Inc. has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
•	Compliance Audit – Stampede Meat, Inc. has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Stampede Meat, Inc. PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  An initial compliance audit was conducted on June 28, 2007. Three (3) year compliance audits have been conducted on June 16, 2010, June 18, 2013, August 9, 2017, and September 13, 2023. 
•	Hot Work Permits – Stampede Meat, Inc. has developed a best management practice for hot work. 
 

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Stampede Meat, Inc. facility has not experienced an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

VIII.	Emergency Response Program
Stampede Meat, Inc. has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 

Stampede Meat, Inc. has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has interacted (i.e. onsite inspections) with the Bridgeview Fire Department.

III.	Facility Identification
The Stampede Meat, Inc. facility is located at 7351 South 78th Avenue in Bridgeview, Illinois.  Stampede Meat, Inc. specializes in custom made, center of the plate beef and pork entrees for the needs of the restaurant and hospital industries.  Stampede creates seasoned and prepared value added meats, portioned cuts, and fully cooked beef and pork products.     

The NAICS code for the facility is 311612.  Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to preserve ingredients and products.   

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one (1) refrigeration system onsite that is used for refrigerating ingredients, process areas, and products. 

The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system is approximately 20,800 pounds.  The refrigeration system is used to cool process rooms, holding freezers, coolers, docks and blast freezers.  

An aerial map identifying the site location is included as Appendix A.
